place_description: Luck Factory Games is the place to have fun at Gibson Mill Market in Concord! Luck Factory Games is a board game cafe featuring more than 1,000 board games of all kinds. We serve light bites, desserts, snacks and beverages (including sodas, tea, craft beers, ciders and wine) for customers to enjoy while they play and relax.

reviews_data.review_text: This is the best board game shop in the greater Atlanta area!

This gem is located in Gibson Mill Market's lower level! This board game cafe hits all the right notes. $8 for unlimited gaming with an extensive, well-organized library. Smart touches like their colored card system for service make everyone comfortable. Staff is super helpful for newcomers, and the space is clean and well-lit. Gets busy on weekend nights with a mix of families, couples, and D&D groups. Only tip: bring a light jacket as it runs cool. Perfect spot for both casual and serious gamers - will definitely return when back in the Charlotte area.

An amazing game store always kept tidy, with extremely friendly staff. I come here specifically for dnd. It's a bit of a drive for me but so worth it. It's the only game store I've found that run consistent dnd games and they are very newbie friendly. The first time I showed up to a game a few months ago I had no character, no dice, no experience, and I was 20 minutes late, but Steph went with it in stride giving me a character sheet, one of the other players had extra dice they let me borrow and everyone helped me through the process of learning to play. Even if everyone else is a higher level they will try to accommodate you with giving you some hits without taking damage or a special ability to help you stay in the game or they will let you know if you should prepare a higher level character if you talk to them in their discord server. That's were all the rsvps for their game nights are anyways.
There's also food and drinks. The food comes from one of the restaurants upstairs and there is a Veggie burger available for vegetarians. Lots of non-alcoholic options to drink as well. The space feels very inclusive and welcoming. I couldn't have asked for a better experience. I look forward to it every week.

LFG is always a blast! Amazing selection of games. Great beers on tap that rotate regularly so you always have something new to try. The staff is so wonderful; friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable! Highly recommend jumping in on a DnD session... great for first time players or seasoned veterans! Check out the LFG website for play times and more info, but I can't recommend it enough!
Such a cool place with great people.  We've been going every other week since summer.   Good for all ages.

I just love coming here with my sister on weekends and weekdays this place is just fun especially if u like DND or table top games I have been coming here for probably 2 years now great place also if I have kids.

This place has almost become my second home with their welcoming staff and community. Are you looking to get into DnD or any other table top game? Then you'll easily find people there that are more than happy to help you get into it and answer questions that may come up while you have a blast.
Great place to play one of their hundreds of games of all difficulty levels with a cold beverage

My wife and kids took me here for my birthday. At first I was a little skeptical, but had an absolute blast. Beer and snacks and board games is a great combination. Awesome opportunity to test drive games before buying them as well.
Such a cool place

Luck Factory Games went above and beyond in their organization and hospitality to host a corporate social for our company. Not only were they extremely kind and overly prepared, but they also made it an incredible event for everyone in attendance! Our employees raved about their space and all of the game offerings that they had available. They coordinated and ran two larger team-building events for us that were an awesome experience for our employees. We loved seeing the engagement and collaboration! They also had great food packages at a very reasonable cost for us to select from for the event. If you are considering this space for a corporate event I would highly recommend it to you on all levels! Nic, Alison, Jess, and the rest of their staff are wonderful!
I found this gem when looking for a board game store , for my husband birthday. $8 a person the staff provides recommendations on games to play and it setup so you can easily find a game to enjoy
Tons of games to play, staff is super friendly. I even get to own the store every now and then! Hi Nick!
Such a cute place, attached to a food hall. We had a great time.

I've been to many game stores and cafes, this is my favorite.  They way they run the cafe is great, having someone who helps teach games and get you setup with drink and snacks.  The people were friendly and there was a ton of games to pick from. Will be back again!
Great place for a chill night playing board games.
Love this place! So fun. I do wish they were open later on the weekends though!
Awesome collection of games and different varieties, Absolutely Loved it

Variety of games, nice and entertaining. Upstairs has plenty of food and reminds you of a food truck or mall setting with numerous options. The pizza was great from a local vendor. Parking is very adequate for the building as it was very busy after we got there. Lot of people started trickling in and the entire hall was at capacity. Come early on Saturday like 530ish as you will maybe find a seat or you can reserve one online. There is a good selection of tables and chairs but they can go quick if it's a busy night. The games range from different categories and low to difficult on the game boxes. All games are returned to the table to be checked I assume and placed back where they belong on the shelf. We will return and it is recommended for a neat getaway from the norm.
Amazing game selection and the staff... I drive an hour to come to this place and it's so worth it...
Such a fun place with a helpful, kind staff.
Amazing place to chill and game! They have over 1,000 games to choose from and plenty of space to find a table for any size group.

This place ROCKS! I love getting together with friends here when I'm in town. They have a great selection of games, lots of comfortable varied seating, and helpful game guides. If you're into board games, this place is a great visit!
Just walked through and admired the selection of games. Can't wait to come back and play games from their library.

Such a great place for date night, family night, etc. the staff was so friendly and helpful! We had a great time trying out new games and playing favorites. Such a cool place. We'll definitely be back!

Totally unique place to play whatever game your heart desires! If you ever have a night where you're not sure what to do or where to go, you need to come to Lucky Factory Games. Only $5 per person and you can play board games, card games, dice games, etc!
The staff are also very helpful. They asked us questions to determine what games would be the most fun for us and provided great recommendations for games that we have never even heard of.
A super cool and creative idea! Fun for all ages and games you haven't seen in years! Snacks are delicious and offer alcohol as well!

I have brought my little sister from the big brother big sister program in Cabbarus county a few times! The staff is always extremely helpful in selecting a game! Such a great idea and we always have a good time!
Nice little shop with cafe area to play board games, Ultimate Werewolf was fun to play there on their game night.

Absolutely amazing place! The staff know the games and what to recommend based on what you're looking for, and are ready to help answer questions. Their snack and drink selection are delicious as well.

The staff and service here are great.
Fantastic library of boardgames to play.
Wonderful sit and play areas.
Great place to spend some time on a rainy day!
The space is quite open and accommodating to small or large parties. The table side service for snacks/drinks was the perfect touch for an uninterrupted gaming sesh.

We stumbled upon Luck Factory in April of 2022 while visiting from the Atlanta area. My husband and I have played board and card games in the past so it sounded like a fun store to browse. That's all we initially thought we'd do- browse. Well , we ended up spending hours here on our first visit and had such an amazing time! Nick, the owner explained the store and table reservation system and the system for asking for help with a game. If you're not sure what kind of game you'd like and are open to suggestions he has an ingenious 3 question quiz for you to help you find that perfect game. We ended up learning Wingspan , King of Tokyo , and a few others that day and brought home a giant bag of new games.  I am not exaggerating when I say this spontaneous visit to Luck Factory  was the origin story to our current board game obsession and now we host monthly game nights back home. If we didn't live 4 hours away we'd absolutely be VIP Members! One thing you need to know - this place is special. Since returning to the Atalanta area we've scoured our area for something similar and while we've found a handful of places absolutely nothing compares to Luck Factory and how welcome we feel there , the level of help we can get if we need it , the friendliness of everyone who works there and the HUGE library of games to play. They are very family friendly ! The places near us all are fine but each lacks something. Either they cater solely to RPGs (we couldn't even get anyone to talk to us at one place bc we didn't apparently fit the look of their target customers) , or another place with super friendly people and large library but no one to help you learn new games, or lastly just a big store with only one tiny shelf of games to play. So clearly Luck Factory is a gem and if you're LUCKY enough to have this near you (or if visiting the area like we were) please go check them out. Even if you feel intimidated about learning a new game , Nick and his staff are such good teachers the way they explain things. You can learn simple or complicated games and be successful! To this day some of the games we learned at Luck Factory on that first visit and in subsequent visits since are still are go-to favorites- Wingspan, King Of Tokyo, Five Tribes , Splendor, Quacks of Quedlinburg and more. We joke that it's both good and bad that we live 4 hours away. Seriously go . Just go. Take a friend , take your family. Meet Nick, answer his 3 questions and find your next perfect game.

This was such a cute board game cafe! $5 per person to play any board games, and they offered a variety of canned/bottled drinks and some snacks. The hardest thing was trying to figure out what to play! There was a huge selection. Good for family nights or friends' get-togethers!

Amazing selection of games, and the staff is very, very good at suggesting games to play and also helping your group to learn new games. They had games for every skill level. Our whole family from ages 4-38 years old had a great time! Can't wait to go back.
Great place to hang out with any sized group! Been here on a date and for a birthday party- same amount of fun.

Love this new place to hang out and play games. Such a novel idea and the owner Nick is incredibly friendly. We love hanging out with family and I even had my last birthday celebration there. So many games and hours of fun!
We spent hours here! Such a cute space and literally pretty much any game you could want.... Very family friendly too. We will be back

My girlfriend and I had a blast here! The staff is very accommodating and friendly; we're definitely coming back to try new board games soon! It's definitely worth every penny and not to mention the snacks and the ENDLESS amount of board games and events. I appreciate that this place exists.
My son and I were impressed with the amount of games available to play.  The staff were very friendly and helpful!  We will definitely be back!

We really enjoyed our afternoon at Luck Factory Games. We got a try out a game that we had been thinking about adding to our collection. The staff was very knowledge and made some great suggestions for a few other games that we tried out.  This place is great for a date, but also very kid friendly. We'll be back for sure!
Great family space with an awesome game selection

When we had first discovered this place we were in heaven. Something near our house to escape to. We were told that magic players got free entry friday and Saturday nights. So that following weekend my girlfriend and I came and had a blast playing magic with strangers. We bought beers and took home some goodies from the counter. A couple weeks later we came back with our family for another fun night. We played magic, bought beers and as we were closing our tab the total came out to nearly double what we had paid the previous time. We asked why and the lady said it was because of the entry fee. We said that we were magic players(expecting she'd give us the free pass like she had done the weeks prior) nope. She looked at us like we were crazy and trying to scam her. Keep in mind this is the same woman who told us about free magic nights.....as a customer I felt lied to, manipulated, and cheated. I had bragged to people about this place and was beyond excited to being the family. Never again. If the free Magic night was limited then say that. Pretending like it was never a thing is just plain wrong. Yall need to figure out whats real and what's not. Lying to a customer to promote your business is crossing the line.
Great gaming place
Great fun, excellent selection of games.  Awesome staff and owners.

Fun!!!!  What a fun way to change up game day/night..

Co-Located in an old (factory) with a brewery and food places.  Once inside Tables & booths surrounded with shelves filled with games.  Thousands of games.  Board games, table games, card games.

Pay when your done. 5$ per person to play as many games as you want and for as long as you can stand it.

Bonus - check out the very large antique store located next door.
This place was so much fun! I've been to a couple places like this, but this was my favorite. Their system works wonderfully!
This place is such a vibe!! I had such an amazing time, you literally cannot beat the price either. Unlimited games for $5 and they have plenty of refreshments & outstanding customer service!!

What a day!!  Great board game place...great selection of games to play, with a super helpful staff!  $5 cover to go, play all day.  Games for all ages and families!
Will definitely be back...convenient meet up place.
This place is simply marvelous!!  What a  great concept for getting families and friends back together again!

I run a once a month teen social D&D game here! We have a blast. Nick is incredibly accommodating of the sensory needs of the teen group and the snacks are delicious! They have a great selection of games, lots of space to play, and a wonderfully welcoming atmosphere!

Staff is amazing! I was struggling to pick a game and am employee came up, asked a few questions, and now we have a new favorite game! Great for playing the familiar family favorites or learning a new strategy game.

This is a great spot to find a new group to game with or to bring your friends and family for a fun evening away from home! Everyone is very welcoming. The owner is a great guy with a passion for games. Don't hesitate in checking LFG out!

My wife and I had an awesome time here visiting for the first time! Nick was super helpful with giving us recommendations for games to try and also explaining all the rules to us! We'll definitely be back with friends!

Looking for something to do, bored, trying to do something fun with a group, like board games, know someone that does? This is the place to go to. So cool and chill. They're next to the brewery and they have snacks too. This place is huge, private room, storefront, Cafe area, big library of games. I was impressed by the wide variety of games they had in the library. This is part of the Gibson Mill that they are redoing/remodeling a great addition and nothing really like it nearby. They even have membership options for the whole family if you guys like family game nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Plenty of parking, decent hours for now perfect place to spend on a rainy day.
This place has been on my bucket list for ages. We spent a solid five hours here! All staff were super accommodating. Cant wait to come again!!!

Fun!
Great selections for games, good old fashioned family fun with so many games and best of all, no screen time!
Family owned, small business owners, love this place. We have been two days in a row, can't wait to come back!
Amazing concept! Lots of games in a safe space with snacks and excellent service - what more could you ask for!

This was the perfect place to spend a few hours out of the 104 degree heat while waiting for a flight out of Charlotte. We played a few games we knew and tried one we had never played before. The time flew!
Great place for a group of friends or family's! The staff was super knowledgeable and helpful. Can't wait to come back!

This place is GREAT. We've gone twice now, once for board games and once for D&D, both times were excellent. The staff is really friendly but not pushy at all, the place is comfy and clean, there are literally thousands of board games to play... I literally have no complaints.
Never knew a place like this existed! We had family come in from out of town and we stumbled upon this gem! The staff is so friendly and  inviting. We will be back!!

So much fun!! The description doesn't lie, there are truly so many games. Anything we wanted to do we were able to find, plus more. We'll be back for sure!

Added bonus- the mill is a cute area with lots of fun places to drop in and out of, can't wait to see what else opens up near you all soon.
Absolutely incredible establishment! The staff is amazing and it feels so homie. If you love games, you'll love this place.

This was such a fun event! I wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. This is such a neat concept. You pay a small entrance fee in order to stay and play as many games as you would like. And they have PLENTY to choose from. With over 1,000 games available, you are sure to find something you enjoy. After each play, every game is checked to make sure all of the pieces are there. There are snacks and drinks available for purchase.

The owners are amazing....very friendly and accommodating. They facilitated our large group in a game of Werewolf, which was sooooo much fun.

I definitely plan to come back with my family and take advantage of some screen-free fun!
Came here for my wife birthday. The staff, game selection, and concessions are amazing! Will for sure be a regular!
A great place to go an spend an evening playing games. I go every Wednesday night I can to play D&D.

If you want a friendly, laid back atmosphere to spend time laughing with friends or family then. Get. Here.  Tons of games and the best part is that no one needs to argue over the rules because they will help you with that. Delicious snacks  and beverages (even the adults ones) are available.

It's a neat place with lots of playable games but they have barely anything to buy and the used section for purchase was well overpriced. They had used tiny epic games, non deluxe, listed at 35 when I went there and you can get the deluxe for 35 from gamelyn or even from the game shop 4 minutes away. Basically go to play, not to buy.

My husband and I have been frequenting this place for a while it is our favorite place. The first time we came in we were amazed by the wonderful welcoming atmosphere and the concept of the place. For a super low price you spend the day playing board games and have someone who's has played help explain the rules. I seriously can not express how cool this place is and it's family friendly too! Love love love this place and the people who work there! You HAVE to visit if you're in the area!!

Found this place through a Google search looking for something to do with my daughter and what a find! We had such a blast there exploring the "endless" games that this place has. The staff were super friendly and welcoming. They even recommended and taught us how to play a couple of games. Will definitely be back with the family.

Come here to play your games. It is honestly the best environment I've played games in (this is based off my first experience). D&D on Wednesday nights was a blast! The owner is all about the experience people have from being there and having fun; seeking merchandise is secondary. Enjoy your time!
Awesome place everyone is super friendly, and they have more games than you could play in a lifetime haha.  We've been here dozen of times and will continue to go!

Hello from Canada!

We were looking to kill time while visiting family in Concord and we happened to stumble upon this lovely little board game cafe nested in Gibson Mill. What a pleasant surprise it was.

I need to say that we have some board game pubs here in Montreal, but none of them have games nearly as clean and as organized as LFG -- also a lot less crowded/noisy than in Montreal so it was such a nice experience!

You pay $5 per person and you have a huge selection of board games to choose from, most of which the staff can merrily explain the rules to you.
(We definitely took advantage of the "We Need Help!" card)

So anyway, we had a lot fun and discovered many great games. Thanks for bearing with us and hopefully see you next time!

This place is great! You grab a table, order snacks and/or drinks, and go pick out a game from any shelf. All the games are labeled with category, number of players, difficulty, and how long they take to play. The staff members and owner are really helpful, and they can explain how to play almost any of the games, in case you're one of the folks who likes to jump in, rather than memorizing the instruction manual. Just $5 to play, and stay as long as you like. They also have a gift shop where you can buy new and used games!
Super friendly staff and so many games to choose from. Great fun environment
So fun and staff was very helpful-great selection plus access to high branch beer is great!

My absolute favorite venue for low key fun in Concord. Wonderful and helpful staff, tons of engaging board games, ample food and drink. This is my go-to fun stop when I have family in town and want to have a fun time! From my kids to my mother, everyone I've brought to Luck Factory Games has had just a wonderful time.
A great place for family board game night or a place to hang with your friends!

As someone who gets overwhelmed easily, I was a little nervous picking my first game. Everyone who works here is SO helpful. They give you game suggestions based on what you're looking for. The owner even came over to us and offered to explain the game instructions to us. This made the game 100x easier to learn! Highly recommend checking them out!
Awesome place to check out.  Beer, food, and games what's not to like!  Nick was great getting us setup with our game!

Found this amazing gem of a place yesterday and couldn't have been happier! The selection of games is incredible, and the game-tenders were so welcoming and super knowledgeable! They were also appropriately attentive, with their clever card signal system!

The space is also really nice. Very clean and spacious, with a good mix of concession options, and adjacent to the new High Branch Brewing location if you want an extended beverage menu.

I was also really impressed with their plans for future events, pricing options (allowing pay-per-visit or a cancel-any-time subscription model), and Ambassador program!

On the whole, a must-visit for anyone who enjoys table games of any kind. Or just fun in general.  Definitely roll the dice on this place; you won't be disappointed!

Absolutely massive library of games to pick from with a friendly, knowledgeable staff to coach you through some of the more complex ones. Play all you want for only $5 a person. Snacks are available and you can grab a drink from the attached brewery. They also have tons of events and tournaments going on frequently.
I had the best time!! Every game you can imagine is there. Super friendly & knowledgeable staff. Could seriously stay there all day. So much fun!

This place is awesome. Friendly knowledgeable staff. More games to play than able to count. Want to play a new game, staff will help you learn it. Will be going back. Family game night, but yet going out.
Great selection, friendly staff
Celebrated a birthday at luck Factory tonight. Had a fantastic time with the family playing games!staff was incredible. Love the place,wish you much success!!

Incredible space to meet with friends and game! The staff and game selection are outstanding! Highly recommend to beginners and experienced gamers. Plus you can grab a beer next door. It doesn't get any better.

I have now visited luck factory games several times and have thoroughly enjoyed myself.   The staff is super enthusiastic about their craft and take good care of their customers.

A.couple of cool things that make them different from other game stores.

1. They or their ambassadors will teach you the games and you can play before you buy.
2. They have around 1000 different games to play so instead of taking a chance buying a game you haven't played., see if they have it and sample it.
3.  It's a cafe. Eat,  drink be merry.   Where else can you enjoy a beer and a game.
4. It's family friendly and safe.  I bright my kids and they had a blast.
Wonderfully place! Our family had great day of gaming and cheating on our diets!  There's good and delicious variety of snacks, served by a courteous and friendly staff!
Played several games, enjoyed some snacks.   Great service, great selection of games and a fabulous vibe.  This place is great for all ages.   I highly recommend LFG!
We had a great time at Luck Factory Games!! All of the staff were super friendly and helpful! They have a great selection of food and games! We'll definitely be back soon!
